metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9674 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Lib/zipfile.py in Python through 3.7.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via a ZIP bomb.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9674` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this is a documentation change only

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.18-1~20.04.1').
